sections.heading: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Bath Salts Prohibition Act.
sections.text: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Bath Salts Prohibition Act.

sections.heading: Findings.  The General Assembly finds the following:
sections.text: Findings. The General Assembly finds the following:

sections.heading: Purpose.  The purpose of this Act is to ban the sale of all synthetic cathinones sold under the disguise of legitimate products such as "bath salts" and other various labels in this State in order to protect the health and public safety of  residents of this State
sections.text: Purpose. The purpose of this Act is to ban the sale of all synthetic cathinones sold under the disguise of legitimate products such as "bath salts" and other various labels in this State in order to protect the health and public safety of residents of this State.

sections.heading: Definitions. As used in this Act:
sections.text: Definitions. As used in this Act:

sections.heading: Prohibition.  A person may not sell or offer for sale any bath salts in a retail mercantile establishment located within this State.
sections.text: Prohibition. A person may not sell or offer for sale any bath salts in a retail mercantile establishment located within this State.

sections.heading: Penalties. Any person who violates this Act is guilty of a Class 3 felony for which a fine of not more than $150,000 may be imposed.
sections.text: In addition to any other penalty that may be imposed for a violation of this Act, the unit of local government that issued a retailer's license for the retail mercantile establishment whose merchant violated this Act may revoke the retailer's license of that retail mercantile establishment upon conviction for a violation of this Act.
